org.matrix.androidsdk.call

Interface IMXCall

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MXCall, MXChromeCall, MXWebRtcCall

    public interface IMXCall
    Audio/video call interface. See MXWebRtcCall and MXChromeCall.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  IMXCall.MXCallListener 
      static class  IMXCall.VideoLayoutConfiguration

        Create the callview

      • onPause

        The activity is paused.

      • onResume

        void onResume()
        The activity is resumed.

      • placeCall

        void placeCall(IMXCall.VideoLayoutConfiguration aLocalVideoPosition)
        Start a call.
        Parameters:
        aLocalVideoPosition - position of the local video attendee

      • prepareIncomingCall

        void prepareIncomingCall(JsonObject aCallInviteParams,
                         String aCallId,
                         IMXCall.VideoLayoutConfiguration aLocalVideoPosition)
        Prepare a call reception.
        Parameters:
        aCallInviteParams - the invitation Event content
        aCallId - the call ID
        aLocalVideoPosition - position of the local video attendee

      • launchIncomingCall

        void launchIncomingCall(IMXCall.VideoLayoutConfiguration aLocalVideoPosition)
        The call has been detected as an incoming one. The application launched the dedicated activity and expects to launch the incoming call.
        Parameters:
        aLocalVideoPosition - position of the local video attendee

      • updateLocalVideoRendererPosition

        void updateLocalVideoRendererPosition(IMXCall.VideoLayoutConfiguration aConfigurationToApply)
        The video will be displayed according to the values set in aConfigurationToApply.
        Parameters:
        aConfigurationToApply - the new position to be applied

      • handleCallEvent

        void handleCallEvent(Event event)
        Manage the call events.
        Parameters:
        event - the call event.

        void answer()
        The call is accepted.

        The call has been has answered on another device.

        The call is hung up.

              Room callSignalingRoom)
        Set the linked rooms (conference call)
        Parameters:
        room - the room
        callSignalingRoom - the call signaling room.

      • getCallSignalingRoom

        Room getCallSignalingRoom()
        Returns:
        the call signaling room

      • getSession

        MXSession getSession()
        Returns:
        the session

      • isIncoming

        boolean isIncoming()
        Returns:
        true if the call is an incoming call.

      • setIsIncoming

        void setIsIncoming(boolean isIncoming)
        Parameters:
        isIncoming - true if the call is an incoming one.

      • setIsVideo

        void setIsVideo(boolean isVideo)
        Set the call type: video or voice
        Parameters:
        isVideo - true for video call, false for VoIP

      • isVideo

        boolean isVideo()
        Returns:
        true if the call is a video call.

      • setIsConference

        void setIsConference(boolean isConference)
        Defines the call conference status

      • isConference

        boolean isConference()
        Returns:
        true if the call is a conference call.

      • getCallState

        String getCallState()
        Returns:
        the callstate (must be a CALL_STATE_XX value)

      • getCallView

        android.view.View getCallView()
        Returns:
        the callView

      • getVisibility

        int getVisibility()
        Returns:
        the callView visibility

      • setVisibility

        boolean setVisibility(int visibility)
        Set the callview visibility
        Returns:
        true if the operation succeeds

      • getCallStartTime

        long getCallStartTime()
        Returns:
        the call start time in ms since epoch, -1 if not defined.

      • getCallElapsedTime

        long getCallElapsedTime()
        Returns:
        the call elapsed time in seconds, -1 if not defined.

      • switchRearFrontCamera

        boolean switchRearFrontCamera()
        Switch between device cameras. The transmitted stream is modified according to the new camera in use. If the camera used in the video call is the front one, calling switchRearFrontCamera(), will make the rear one to be used, and vice versa. If only one camera is available, nothing is done.
        Returns:
        true if the switch succeed, false otherwise.

      • isCameraSwitched

        boolean isCameraSwitched()
        Indicate if a camera switch was performed or not. For some reason switching the camera from front to rear and vice versa, could not be performed (ie. only one camera is available).


        See switchRearFrontCamera().

        Returns:
        true if camera was switched, false otherwise

      • isSwitchCameraSupported

        boolean isSwitchCameraSupported()
        Indicate if the device supports camera switching.

        See switchRearFrontCamera().

        Returns:
        true if switch camera is supported, false otherwise

      • muteVideoRecording

        void muteVideoRecording(boolean isVideoMuted)
        Mute/Unmute the recording of the local video attendee. Set isVideoMuted to true to enable the recording of the video, if set to false no recording is performed.
        Parameters:
        isVideoMuted - true to mute the video recording, false to unmute

      • isVideoRecordingMuted

        boolean isVideoRecordingMuted()
        Return the recording mute status of the local video attendee.


        See muteVideoRecording(boolean).

        Returns:
        true if video recording is muted, false otherwise
